item.title: Advent Of Code 2020
item.description: For years I’ve been a fan of the idea behind Advent of Code, an Advent calendar of small programming puzzles for a variety of skill sets and skill levels that can be solved in any programming language you like. For a variety of reasons I’ve neglected participating in past editions, but this year I’ve finally decided to give it a try. The biggest reason behind the decision to join this year was that for the longest time I had the desire to become proficient in any of the many LISP languages out there, particularly in Clojure, so I saw this as a chance to get more familiar with it, learn something more about it, and having fun while doing so.
